Hi,
   I keep getting the a NullPointerException after creating a Visual Class. The stack trace is posted at the end of the message.

   I can constantly reproduce this bug:
   Step 0: Enable the Log Error viewer.
   Step 1: Create a new Virtual Class, I selected SWT Composite.
   Step 2: Click on the composite area.
   Step 3: Visually inspect the ErrorLog area.

   I hope the stack trace helps.

Patrick

I would like to follow up on this bug...
I jumped the gun here... however there is still some sort of problem...
The VE cache got badly messed up, that is why I kept getting a bunch of exceptions. I switched workspaces and everything worked fine.

I would like to note however, that if it would be possible to have a "button" somewhere that would safely clean all the cached data generated from VE, that way the user won't have to go searching on the .metadata for VE related stuff.

Note: I don't know if this will make a diference or not, but I had a .JETEmmiters project with one or two classes sitting there... Before I went on my rampage to clean the .metadata I saw that there other classes not generated by me.... Do you guys use that Folder for anything? If you do this could be where some of the corruption ocurred.

Regards and I am sorry for posting a non-bug...,
Patrick Sodre
Rich, have you seen it before?

I haven't seen that particular one, but it probably is due to a cache problem.


And we do have a clear cache function:

1) Open a VE editor, and then close it and all VE editors that are open.
2) Do Project->Clean...->Clean all, and wait for the build to finish
3) The cache is now cleared.
I agree... I think it was a bad cache problem.
